channel.title: DVI cable questions
channel.description: 1) what is the difference between a single and a dual dvi link cable? (show pictures please...) 2) does it matter which I have? 3) are there any vga to dvi 4) are there any dvi to vga 5) can I use vga to dvi, and then dvi to hdmi lol

item.title: DVI cable questions
item.dc:creator: @Java-RSPS-Noob Java-RSPS-Noob
item.description:
@Java-RSPS-Noob wrote:

[quote=“Niall, post:2, topic:529136”]1) http://communities.intel.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-170979-230419/748c3777_dvi_connector_types.gif
2) yes and no, what are you using it for
3) yes, but see 2), you can use a vga > dvi if it’s coming from a digital source (computer), but from an analogue source you may need an analogue to digital converter
4) see above, dvi from a digital source to a digital vga receiver is fine
5) yes, if it’s all digital

vga, dvi and hdmi are all just cables at the end of the day, if it’s from a digital source like a computer to a digital receiver like a computer monitor then it doesn’t matter (mostly) what cables you use, the problems come when you try to use things like OLLLLLLLLDDDDDDDDDD TVs which have a vga or a rca cable and you try to plug a hdmi from a digital source into it

of course there are exceptions, you can hook a pc up to a tv with a rca cable, but again, it depends, tell us what you’re trying to do if you want a more specific answer[/quote][s]thanks for the picture…

I am still unsure of which one I need to get though haha. It doesn’t state on the best buy product which dvi type it is? I’m now under the assumption that you have to use the proper dvi type cable with that dvi port…

Is it possible to get a dvi cable of one type and a dvi cable on the other side of another type if needed?

the purpose is to use the dvi port on the new computer and use it with my old lcd flat planel dell monitor I assume that’s “digital” enough?

Edit: from the picture you showed me it appears I have a DVI-D (Dual Link) on my monitor don’t know about computer yet[/s]

[hr][hr]

According to the image you posted I think it’s a DVI-D (dual link)

I found this

http://www.bestbuy.com/site/Dual+Link+DVI-D+Cable/1304807883.p?id=mp1304807883&skuId=1304807883&st=dvi-d%20cable&cp=1&lp=11

I assume that is what I need cause my monitor is Dual link DVI-D

but… on this link

http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16814161426&nm_mc=KNC-GoogleAdwords&cm_mmc=KNC-GoogleAdwords--pla--Desktop+Graphics+Cards-_-N82E16814161426&gclid=CObtvdTkqrkCFUkS7Aod1XQAiw

it appears the 7850 is a DVI-I Dual Link?

Is there a DVI-D Dual to DVI-I dual link cable? Or could I use a DVI-D dual to HDMI?

Read full topic

item.title: DVI cable questions
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

  1. http://communities.intel.com/servlet/JiveServlet/showImage/2-170979-230419/748c3777_dvi_connector_types.gif
  2. yes and no, what are you using it for
  3. yes, but see 2), you can use a vga > dvi if it’s coming from a digital source (computer), but from an analogue source you may need an analogue to digital converter
  4. see above, dvi from a digital source to a digital vga receiver is fine
  5. yes, if it’s all digital

vga, dvi and hdmi are all just cables at the end of the day, if it’s from a digital source like a computer to a digital receiver like a computer monitor then it doesn’t matter (mostly) what cables you use, the problems come when you try to use things like OLLLLLLLLDDDDDDDDDD TVs which have a vga or a rca cable and you try to plug a hdmi from a digital source into it

of course there are exceptions, you can hook a pc up to a tv with a rca cable, but again, it depends, tell us what you’re trying to do if you want a more specific answer

Read full topic
